recipe.title: Penne with Grilled Zucchini, Ricotta Salata, and Mint
ingredients: 2 pounds small zucchini, trimmed, halved lengthwise
1/4 cup fresh mint leaves, thinly sliced
2 pinches of dried crushed red pepper
3/4 cup crumbled ricotta salata (salted dry ricotta cheese; about 3 ounces)*
Ricotta salata is a firm cheese with a mildly salty flavor. It's available at some supermarkets and specialty foods stores, and at Italian markets.
instructions: Prepare barbecue (medium-high heat). Arrange zucchini on rimmed baking sheet; brush all over with oil. Sprinkle with coarse salt and black pepper. Grill zucchini until tender, about 4 minutes per side. Transfer to work surface; cut crosswise into 1-inch pieces. Place in large serving bowl. Add vinegar, mint, and crushed red pepper; set aside. Cook pasta in boiling salted water until just tender but still firm to bite. Drain. Add pasta to zucchini mixture, then add 3 tablespoons olive oil and ricotta salata and toss. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
